<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(m)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Recently issued and adopted accounting pronouncements (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On January&nbsp;1, 2009, the Company adopted a new accounting standard on determining whether an instrument (or embedded feature) is indexed to an entity&#146;s own stock. This standard provides a two-step model to determine if an instrument, or embedded feature in an instrument, can be considered indexed to an entity&#146;s own stock for the purpose of determining if the instrument can be accounted for as equity or as a derivative presented outside of equity. The adoption of this standard had no material impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In May&nbsp;2009, the FASB established general standards for accounting and disclosure of events that occur after the balance sheet date but before the financial statements are issued or are available to be issued. The pronouncement required the disclosure of the date through which an entity has evaluated subsequent events and the basis for that date, whether that date represents the date the financial statements were issued or were available to be issued. In February&nbsp;2010, the FASB amended this standard whereby SEC filers, like the Company, are required by GAAP to evaluate subsequent events through the date its financial statements are issued, but are no longer required to disclose in the financial statements that the Company has done so or disclose the date through which subsequent events have been evaluated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In August&nbsp;2009, the FASB provided clarification when measuring liabilities at fair value in a circumstance in which a quoted price in an active market for an identical liability is not available. A reporting entity is required to measure fair value using one or more of the following methods: 1)&nbsp;a valuation technique that uses a)&nbsp;the quoted price of an identical liability when traded as an asset or b)&nbsp;quoted prices for similar liabilities (or similar liabilities when traded as assets) and/or 2)&nbsp;a valuation technique that is consistent with the preexisting fair value guidance. It also clarifies that when estimating the fair value of a liability, a reporting entity is not required to adjust the estimate to include inputs relating to the existence of transfer restrictions on that liability. The adoption of this guidance did not have a material impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In October&nbsp;2009, the FASB issued an update to existing guidance on accounting for arrangements with multiple deliverables. This update will allow companies to allocate consideration received for qualified separate deliverables using estimated selling price for both delivered and undelivered items when vendor-specific objective evidence or third-party evidence is unavailable. Additional disclosures discussing the nature of multiple element arrangements, the types of deliverables under the arrangements, the general timing of their delivery, and significant factors and estimates used to determine estimated selling prices will be required. This guidance is effective prospectively for interim and annual periods ending after June&nbsp;15, 2010. The Company is currently evaluating the impact this guidance may have, if any, on its consolidated financial statement, but does not anticipate that this updated guidance will have a material impact.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(n)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Immaterial correction of errors
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	In accordance with the guidance of SEC Staff Accounting Bulletins No.&nbsp;99,
<I>
	Materiality
</I>
	, and No.&nbsp;108,
<I>
	Considering the Effects of Prior Year Misstatements when Quantifying Misstatements in Current Year Financial Statements
</I>
	, these interim condensed consolidated financial statements reflect the immaterial correction of errors in the Company&#146;s prior periods described below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 through December&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company amortized mining rights based on actual units of production over estimated reserves, and depreciated mine development costs over estimated useful lives from 15-35 years, rather than amortizing development costs based on proven and probable reserves as described in the Securities Act Industry Guide 7 and the AICPA SEC International Practices Task Force Codification of Highlights as of March&nbsp;2003.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-20
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>

<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(n)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Immaterial correction of errors (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company has determined that the impact of these corrections is not material to any prior annual or interim consolidated financial statements. These immaterial errors have been corrected and are reflected in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheets as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 and December&nbsp;31, 2008, and the consolidated statements of operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, 2008 and 2007. The impact to the Company&#146;s statements of operations and balance sheets for prior periods is as follows:
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<I>
	(o)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Reclassifications
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Certain reclassifications of previously reported amounts have been made to conform to the current period presentation. These reclassifications are primarily due to the presentation of discontinued operations (Note 4).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	BUSINESS ACQUISITIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	2008 acquisition of Mark Faith and its subsidiary
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On March&nbsp;4, 2008 (the &#147;Mark Faith acquisition date&#148;), the Company acquired all of the issued and outstanding capital stock of Mark Faith and its wholly-owned subsidiary Feishang Copper, collectively referred to as &#147;Mark Faith&#148;. The Company acquired Mark Faith from the Shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The Company paid cash of RMB24,252 (US$3,552), which was based on the lesser of the audited consolidated net asset value of Mark Faith as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 or RMB24,252 (US$3,552). In connection with the acquisition, the Company paid the Shareholder RMB47,292 (US$6,926) in satisfaction of outstanding indebtedness of Mark Faith, assumed by the Company, due to the Shareholder. As the audited consolidated net asset value of Mark Faith was RMB2,101 (US$308) below the purchase price of RMB24,252 (US$3,552), Feishang Group refunded RMB2,101 (US$308) to the Company in January&nbsp;2009. Mark Faith was incorporated in Hong Kong in August&nbsp;2006, and operates through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Feishang Copper, a company established under the laws of the PRC in Inner Mongolia.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	Feishang Copper's principal business activity is the smelting of copper concentrates to produce blister copper (a highly pure copper produced during an intermediate stage of copper smelting). The production process also produces sulfuric acid, gold and silver. The copper smelting plant of Feishang Copper is located at Bayannaoer City, Inner Mongolia, the PRC, approximately 1,050 kilometers north of Beijing. The Company acquired Mark Faith and its subsidiary as a means of integrating its mining and exploration activities with smelting operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-21
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	BUSINESS ACQUISITIONS (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	2008 acquisition of Mark Faith and its subsidiary (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The acquisition of Mark Faith and its subsidiary was accounted for using the purchase method of accounting. The purchase price was allocated among the assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their estimated fair values, which management believes approximated their net book value. Because the acquisition was from a related party shareholder (the Shareholder), the excess of the consideration paid over the net assets acquired was shown separately as a deduction from equity, equivalent to a distribution of equity to the Shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The following table summarizes the estimated fair values of Mark Faith&#146;s assets and liabilities acquired at the Mark Faith acquisition date:
</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:6.667PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	On December&nbsp;30, 2008, the Company sold 40% of its investment in Mark Faith to an unrelated party. On September&nbsp;29, 2009, the Company sold the remaining 60% of its investment in Mark Faith to the same party (Note 4).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	2009 acquisition of Newhold Investments Limited and its subsidiaries
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-8PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On January&nbsp;12, 2009, the Company acquired all the issued and outstanding capital stock of Newhold Investments Limited (&#147;Newhold&#148;), a BVI company, and its wholly-owned subsidiaries from the Shareholder and assumed the outstanding indebtedness owed by Newhold to the Shareholder on the closing date. The purchase price was RMB287,734 (US$42,147) by reference to the estimated amount of coal resources reflected in the Technical Review Report dated December&nbsp;2008 at not less than 120&nbsp;million tons.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-8PX">
	Newhold was incorporated under the laws of the BVI in July&nbsp;2008. Newhold currently operates, through its wholly-owned subsidiaries Feishang Yongfu and Yangpu Shuanghu, and its 70%-owned subsidiary Guizhou Yongfu, a company established under the laws of the PRC in Guizhou Province. Guizhou Yongfu is an enterprise principally engaged in coal mine development in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; PADDING-RIGHT:-8PX">
	The purchase price of Newhold was allocated among the assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their historical carrying values. Because the acquisition was from a related party shareholder (the Shareholder), the excess of the consideration paid over the net assets acquired has been shown separately as a deduction from equity, equivalent to a distribution of equity to the Shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The following table summarizes Newhold&#146;s assets and liabilities acquired at the acquisition date:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	BUSINESS ACQUISITIONS (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<I>
	(b)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	2009 acquisition of Newhold Investments Limited and its subsidiaries (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The following unaudited pro forma financial information presents the Company&#146;s consolidated results of operations as if the acquisition of Newhold had occurred as of the beginning of each of the periods presented below. The unaudited pro forma financial information is not intended to represent or be indicative of the consolidated results of operations that would have been reported by the Company had the acquisition been completed as of the beginning of the periods presented, and should not be taken as representative of the Company&#146;s future consolidated results of operations or financial condition.

<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN; FLOAT:LEFT">
<I>
	(c)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	2009 purchase of net assets &#150; Pineboom Investment Limited and its subsidiaries
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On July&nbsp;10, 2009, the Company acquired all the issued and outstanding capital stock of Pineboom Investment Limited (&#147;Pineboom&#148;) and its wholly-owned subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Dayun Coal Mine&#148;) from the Shareholder and assumed the outstanding indebtedness owed to the Shareholder by Dayun Coal Mine. The final purchase price was approximately RMB154,382 (US$22,610) by reference to the estimated amount of coal resources reflected in the Technical Review Report at not less than 100&nbsp;million tons. The Company paid cash of RMB100,343 (US$14,694), and has a payable for the remaining balance of RMB54,039 (US$7,916) as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 (Note 12).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	Pineboom, through its subsidiaries, owns a 100% equity interest in Guizhou Dayun, which owns exploration rights to Huajuejingtian North Sector Coal Mine, a coal mine located in Jinsha County, Guizhou Province, the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	Pineboom holds primarily an exploration right with no established infrastructure and no mining equipment at the date of acquisition. The underlying set of assets acquired is not integrated in forming a business to generate revenue. As such, the directors are of the opinion that the acquisition of Pineboom does not constitute a business combination for accounting purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The purchase price of Pineboom was allocated among the assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their historical carrying values. Because the acquisition was from a related party shareholder (the Shareholder), the excess of the consideration paid over the net assets acquired has been shown separately as a deduction from equity, equivalent to a distribution of equity to the Shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-23
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>

<B>
	BUSINESS ACQUISITIONS (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:7.8PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	2009 Purchase of net assets &#150; Pineboom Investment Limited and its subsidiaries (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:7.8PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	In the event the mining right permit covering the target mine has not been issued by the Guizhou Provincial Department Land and Resources on or before July&nbsp;11, 2010, the Company shall be entitled to require the Shareholder to purchase all the shares and indebtedness for a purchase price equal to the consideration with interest at the rate of 12% per annum.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; FONT-FAMILY:CG TIMES,TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The following unaudited pro forma financial information presents the Company&#146;s consolidated results of operations as if the acquisition of Pineboom had occurred as of the beginning of each of the periods presented below. The unaudited pro forma financial information is not intended to represent or be indicative of the consolidated results of operations that would have been reported by the Company had the acquisition been completed as of the beginning of the periods presented, and should not be taken as representative of the Company&#146;s future consolidated results of operations or financial condition.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS - SALE OF MARK FAITH
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:7.8PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On December&nbsp;30, 2008, the Company sold a 40% equity interest in Mark Faith to an unrelated third party for RMB95,586 (US$14,000). The Company received a 5% promissory note which was paid in full, together with interest, in February&nbsp;2009. The Company recognized a gain on the sale of its 40% interest of RMB78,877 (US$11,554) in 2008.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	On September&nbsp;29, 2009, the Company sold its remaining 60% equity interest in Mark Faith to the purchaser of the 40% interest for RMB144,275 (US$21,000). The Company received a 5% promissory note, of which RMB116,741 (US$16,967) was received in 2009, and the remaining principal, together with accrued interest,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-24
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS - SALE OF MARK FAITH (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	was received in full in January&nbsp;2010. At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company has RMB27,534 (US$4,033) due on this promissory note. At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company also has RMB44,236 (US$6,480) due on a promissory note receivable from Mark Faith, which is non-interest bearing and due in 2010, and the Company has RMB97,248 (US$14,245) of non-secured, interest free advances due from Mark Faith. The sale of Mark Faith was made to increase the Company&#146;s working capital and to focus on the Company&#146;s upstream coal and nonferrous metal businesses. The Company recognized a gain on the sale of its 60% interest of RMB123,133 (US$18,036) in 2009. Neither the 2008 or 2009 gains were taxable to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	These entities are controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Li Feilie, who is also an officer, and indirectly, the principal beneficial shareholder of the Company. These amounts represent sales of blister copper, embedded gold in copper and embedded silver in copper.

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">

	At December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009, accumulated depreciation and depletion included accumulated depletion of mining rights of RMB7,136 (US$1,045) and
<A NAME="CHINA_20F_HTM_OLE_LINK3">
</A>
<A NAME="CHINA_20F_HTM_OLE_LINK4">
</A>
	RMB8,475 (US$1,241), respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:30PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:7.8PX; PADDING-LEFT:30PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	INVESTMENTS IN UNCONSOLIDATED INVESTEES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:7.8PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company&#146;s investments in unconsolidated investees include a 48% investment in Hainan Nonferrous Metal and a 45% investment in Guangdong Longchuan. The remaining equity interests held in these entities are held by non-related parties. Both Hainan Nonferrous Metal and Guangdong Longchuan are companies in the exploration stage. Both Hainan Nonferrous Metal and Guangdong Longchuan are primarily engaged in the acquisition and exploration of mineral properties, and both have capitalized mineral property costs in accordance with applicable accounting standards. At the end of each quarter, Hainan Nonferrous Metal and Guangdong Longchuan assess the carrying value for impairment. If proven and probable reserves are established for a property and it has been determined that a mineral property can be economically developed, costs will be amortized using the units-of-production method over the estimated life of the probable reserve.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-26
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(1)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Revenue is from Wuhu Hengchang, a related party.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Guangdong Longchuan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Guangdong Longchuan owns an exploration right located in Guangdong Province, the PRC, which is believed to be a silver, lead, zinc and copper polymetallic mine. Guangdong Longchuan has obtained a mining permit for a 1.45 km&#178; site area of the Jinshizhang mine; and the first stage geochemical exploration, field geology work, geophysics exploration, trenching and drilling activities for the remaining 51.48 km&#178;&nbsp;area are in progress.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-27
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, Guangdong Longchuan losses were applied to the equity investment and reduced the balance to $0. Guangdong Longchuan losses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009 in excess of the carrying value of the Company&#146;s investment in Guangdong Longchuan (RMB506 (US$75)) (RMB2,364 (US$346)), respectively, were applied to reduce the value of the advances receivable due from Guangdong Longchuan (Note 12).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	On February&nbsp;1, 2010, the Company completed the sale of its entire 45% equity interest in Guangdong Longchuan to an unrelated third party for RMB4,753 (US$696) plus the purchaser&#146;s repayment RMB39,796 (US$5,829) of indebtedness to Yangpu Lianzhong.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-28
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-32PX">
	&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	The natural resources fee represents fees payable to the PRC Government and is calculated as a&nbsp;percentage of sales (Note 15).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	The staff compensation fund represents a PRC government-required contribution to a fund established to compensate employees for the loss of their state sponsored pension and post employment benefits upon the acquisition of Anhui by Wuhu Feishang in May&nbsp;2003. The fund is to be distributed to employees at the termination of their employment with Wuhu Feishang. Wuhu Feishang is not required to make any additional contributions to the fund.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	The safety management fee represents a PRC-required contribution for accident prevention programs and accident related costs. The safety management fee is calculated as a&nbsp;percentage of sales.
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11.2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(d)
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11.2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	The provision for production maintenance represents a PRC government-required contribution for future mine maintenance and production. It is calculated based on tons of ore extracted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	9.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	LONG TERM DEBT AND OTHER OBLIGATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:31.467PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On February&nbsp;2, 2009, Guizhou Yongfu obtained a RMB200,000 (US$29,292) long-term bank loan from China Minsheng Banking Corp. Ltd., to be repaid in installments over five years commencing in 2013. The purpose of the loan is to finance the construction of a coal mine. The loan is secured by the mining rights to the Yongsheng Coal Mine, is guaranteed by a related party, and bears a floating annual interest rate of 7.722% (30% above the official over-5-year base lending rate stipulated by The People&#146;s Bank of China). The loan interest is to be paid quarterly. Guizhou Yongfu drew one half of the available balance on the loan in April&nbsp;2009. The RMB100,000 (US$14,648) balance of the loan is expected to be drawn down as needed in accordance with the construction plan for the mine.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	One of Newhold&#146;s subsidiaries, Guizhou Yongfu, had obtained mining rights for the Yongsheng coal mine for total consideration of RMB89,538(US$13,115) prior to the Company&#146;s acquisition of Newhold. This obligation (RMB65,538; US$9,600, at December&nbsp;31, 2009) is payable in installments over ten years to the Guizhou Land and Resources Bureau. This obligation bears interest at a rate stipulated by the People&#146;s Bank of China (5.9% at December&nbsp;31, 2009).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	No U.S. corporate income taxes are provided for in these consolidated financial statements, as management believes that the Company is not subject to US income taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	Under the current laws of the BVI, dividends and capital gains arising from the Company&#146;s investments in the BVI are not subject to income taxes, and no withholding tax is imposed on payments of dividends by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	Wuhu Feishang is governed by the income tax laws of the PRC. Being a Sino-foreign joint venture, the Company was entitled to a preferential income tax rate of 15% for three consecutive years commencing from its third profitable year (2005). Beginning in 2008, income is taxed at 25%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-30
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

</TD>

<TD STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=56.667>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=RIGHT>
	159
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #FFFFFF" VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=3.333>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4.467PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-32PX">
	&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(1)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	These entities are controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Li Feilie, who is also an officer, and indirectly, the principal beneficial shareholder of the Company. These amounts represent sales of blister copper, embedded gold in copper and embedded silver in copper.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(2)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	On September&nbsp;1, 2000, the Company and Anka, a private Hong Kong company that is owned by certain directors of the Company, entered into an office sharing agreement, whereby the Company&#146;s head office in Hong Kong is shared on an equal basis between the two parties. The office sharing agreement also provides that the Company and Anka shall share certain costs and expenses in connection with its use of the office. On July&nbsp;1, 2008, the Company and Anka entered into a new license agreement to replace the office sharing agreement. The license agreement provides that the Company shares certain costs and expenses in connection with its use of the office, in addition to some of the accounting and secretarial services and day-to-day office administration provided by Anka.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-32
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

	WFNM, Wuhu Hengchang, Wuhu Hengxin, Feishang Enterprise, Jiangxi Haiji, Shenzhen Xupu and Feishang Group Limited are controlled by Mr.&nbsp;Li Feilie who is also an officer, director, and indirectly, the principal beneficial shareholder of the Company.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(1)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Receivable from Wuhu Hengxin, owed to Yangpu Lianzhong, due from the sale of copper products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(2)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Receivable from Wuhu Hengchang, owed to Feishang Copper in 2008 and owed to Yangpu Lianzhong in 2009, due from the sale of copper products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(3)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Receivable from Guangdong Longchuan, owed to Yunnan Mining for its acquisition of exploration rights. This receivable is net of an allowance of RMB506 (US$75) as of December&nbsp;31, 2008 and RMB2,364 (US$346) as of December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(4)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Receivable from Jiangxi Haiji, owed to Feishang Copper, and represents a refundable deposit paid in connection with a capital lease, discussed below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(5)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
	Owed by Feishang Group to the Company as a refund of a portion of the Mark Faith purchase price. This amount was received by the Company in January&nbsp;2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(6)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Payable to WFNM from Wuhu Feishang, for expenses paid on behalf of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(7)

	Payable to Feishang Enterprise from Yunnan Mining for the acquisition of Guangdong Longchuan and the net amount of expenses paid by Feishang Enterprise on behalf of Yunnan Mining and certain other subsidiaries.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	EQUITY
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Common stock and warrant subscription agreements
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	In August&nbsp;2007, the Company completed the sale to six non-U.S. persons of an aggregate of 2,187,500 units, each unit consisting of two common shares and one warrant to purchase one common share, for a purchase price of US$16.00 per unit, or an aggregate purchase price of US$35,000. Net proceeds to the Company were RMB264,831 (US$38,788). Each warrant entitles the holder to purchase one common share at an exercise price of US$10.00 per share for a three-year period commencing in August&nbsp;2008.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Stock options
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company has adopted the 2003 Equity Compensation Plan (the &#147;2003 Plan&#148;). The 2003 Plan allows the Board to grant various incentive equity awards not limited to stock options. The Company has reserved a number of shares of common stock equal to 20% of the issued and outstanding common stock of the Company (4,224,683 shares), from time-to-time, for issuance pursuant to options granted (&#147;Plan Options&#148;) or for restricted stock awarded (&#147;Stock Grants&#148;) under the 2003 Plan. Stock Appreciation Rights may be granted as a means of allowing participants to pay the exercise price of Plan Options.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The amount of stock-based compensation recognized during a period is based on the value of the portion of the awards that are ultimately expected to vest. Forfeitures are estimated at the time of grant and revised, if necessary, in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from those estimates. The term &#147;forfeitures&#148; is distinct from &#147;cancellations&#148; or &#147;expirations&#148; and represents only the unvested portion of the surrendered option. For options granted in 2007 and 2008, no forfeiture rate was considered necessary in the estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-34
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The aggregate intrinsic value per option in the table above represents the total intrinsic value (the difference between the closing stock price on December&nbsp;31, 2009 of US$11.80 and the exercise price, multiplied by the number of in-the-money options) that would have been received by the option holders, had all option holders been able to and in fact, had exercised their options on December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008 and 2009, was US$11,646, US$2,397 and nil, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, the aggregate intrinsic value of options outstanding and options exercisable was US$1,974.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
<I>
	2007 transactions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In August&nbsp;2007, 2,300,000 stock options were granted to officers, directors and key employees of the Company at an exercise price of US$8.51 per share (the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock as of the grant date). The options are exercisable commencing on the day following the grant date and terminating three years following the grant date. The estimated fair value of these options at the date of grant using the Black Scholes option pricing model was RMB38,998 (US$5,712) with the following assumptions: risk-free interest rate (the risk-free interest rate for expected term of options) of 4.8%; no dividend yield; volatility (an analysis of historical volatility was used) of 62.4%; and the expected term of the options of one year. The weighted average grant date fair value of options awarded in 2007 was US$2.24 per option. The total fair value of options vested during 2007 was approximately RMB38,998 (US$5,712).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In 2007, options to purchase 1,400,000 shares were exercised and the Company received gross proceeds of RMB88,709 (US$12,993).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-35
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>

<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	EQUITY (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Stock options (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	2008 transactions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In January&nbsp;2008, 1,000,000 stock options were granted to the Company&#146;s CEO at an exercise price of US$22.64 per share (the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock as of the grant date). The options are exercisable commencing on the day following the grant date and terminating three years following the grant date. The estimated fair value of these options at the date of grant using the Black Scholes option pricing model was RMB78,049 (US$11,431), which are being amortized over the requisite service period of three years, with the following assumptions: risk-free interest rate of 3.0%; no dividend yield; volatility of 124.5%; and the expected term of the options of one year. The weighted average grant date fair value of options awarded in 2008 was US$11.43 per option.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In August&nbsp;2008, employee options to purchase 300,000 common shares granted under the equity compensation plan were exercised by Mr.&nbsp;Li Feilie, the Company&#146;s Chairman and CEO, and the Company received gross proceeds of RMB17,472 (US$2,559) in connection therewith.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The total fair value of options vested during 2009 was approximately RMB26,016 (US$3,810). As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, there were 333,333 non-vested options outstanding that had a weighted average exercise price of US$22.64 and a weighted average grant date fair value of US$7.55 per share. Approximately RMB26,017 (US$3,810) in unrecognized compensation expense related to the non-vested options is expected to be recognized in full by 2010.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(c)
</P>

<TD STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX" VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=16.667>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-36
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	EQUITY (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Warrants (continued)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Through December&nbsp;31, 2007, the Company had outstanding warrants that entitled the holder to purchase up to 6,687,500 shares of common stock (2,000,000 at an exercise price of US$4.00 per share for a term of one year; 1,500,000 at an exercise price of US$4.50 per share for a term of two years; 1,000,000 at an exercise price of US$5.00 per share for a term of three years; and 2,187,500 at an exercise price of US$10.00 per share for a term of three years). In February&nbsp;2008, warrants to purchase 2,000,000 common shares were exercised, and the Company received RMB57,557 (US$8,430). In January&nbsp;2009, warrants to purchase 1,500,000 common shares were exercised by Feishang Group, and the Company received gross proceeds of RMB46,398 (US$6,796). In January&nbsp;2010, warrants to purchase 1,000,000 common shares were exercised by Feishang Group, and the Company received gross proceeds of RMB34,135 (US$5,000).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The weighted average grant date fair value of the warrants issued in 2007 was approximately US$4.49 per warrant.
<B>
</B>
	The aggregate intrinsic value of the warrants outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2009 of approximately RMB73,308 (US$10,738) represents the total intrinsic value (the difference between the closing stock price on December&nbsp;31, 2009 of US$11.80 and the exercise price, multiplied by the number of in-the-money warrants) that would have been received by the warrant holders, had all the warrant holders been able to and in fact, had exercised their warrants on December&nbsp;31, 2009. All warrants are fully vested at December&nbsp;31, 2009. The weighted average remaining contractual term of the warrants outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2009 is approximately one year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(d)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Dividend restrictions and reserves
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company&#146;s structure creates restrictions on its payment of dividends. The payment of dividends is also subject to numerous restrictions imposed under PRC law, including restrictions on the conversion of local currency into United States dollars and other currencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	In accordance with the relevant PRC regulations and the Articles of Association of Wuhu Feishang, appropriations of net income as reflected in its PRC statutory financial statements are to be allocated to each of the general reserve and enterprise expansion reserve, respectively, as determined by the resolution of the Board of Directors annually.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	CONCENTRATION OF RISK
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to a significant concentration of credit risk consist principally of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Cash and cash deposits
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company maintains its cash and cash deposits primarily with various PRC State-owned banks and Hong Kong-based financial institutions. The Company performs periodic evaluations of the relative credit standing of those financial institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Trade receivables
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company sells zinc and iron products to companies in the PRC. Management considers that the Company&#146;s current customers are generally creditworthy and credit is extended based on an evaluation of the customers&#146; financial condition and, therefore, generally collateral is not required. The Company maintains an allowance for potential credit losses based on its loss history and aging analysis. Such losses have been within management&#146;s expectations. At December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009, the largest five customers accounted for 89% and 100% of trade receivables, respectively. The allowance for doubtful
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-37
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage119"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	CHINA NATURAL RESOURCES, INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	CONCENTRATION OF RISK (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
<I>
	Trade Receivables (continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	accounts receivable was RMB295 (US$43) at December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, three customers accounted for 59%, 13% and 8%, respectively, of the Wuhu Feishang&#146;s net sales (59%, 13% and 8% of total net sales). During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, three customers accounted for 45%, 17% and 11%, respectively, of Wuhu Feishang&#146;s net sales (34%, 13% and 8% of total net sales). During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, three customers accounted for 32%, 19% and 15%, respectively, of Wuhu Feishang&#146;s net sales (13%, 8% and 6% of total net sales).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	The Company&#146;s entire production of zinc for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008 and 2009 was sold to a single customer, Huludao Zinc Industry Co. Ltd. (&#147;Huludao&#148;). Wuhu Feishang is a party to a one-year non-binding sales contract with Huludao, subject to renewal each year. While the sales contract has been renewed on an annual basis in the past, in the event Wuhu Feishang and Huludao are unable to agree upon renewal terms, or if Wuhu Feishang&#146;s sales contract with Huludao is not renewed for any other reason, Wuhu Feishang will have to identify one or more alternative outlets for its mineral production.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Bills receivable
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Bills receivable represent letters of credit obtained by customers of the Group to finance purchases which have been presented to banks for payment after delivery of goods to customers. As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, the bills receivable balance was guaranteed by banks. The bills receivable have normal terms of maturity of three to six months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
<I>
	Estimates of probable reserves
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF">
	Estimates of probable reserves are subject to considerable uncertainty. Such estimates are, to a large extent, based on the price of metal and ore and interpretations of geologic data obtained from drill holes and other exploration techniques. Producers use feasibility studies to derive estimates of capital and operating costs based upon anticipated tonnage and grades of ore to be mined and processed, the predicted configuration of the ore body, expected recovery rates of metals from the ore, the costs of comparable facilities, the costs of operating and processing equipment and other factors. Actual operating costs and economic returns on projects may differ significantly from original estimates. Further, it may take many years from the initial phase of exploration before production and, during that time, the economic feasibility of exploiting a discovery may change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(e)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:6.667PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Sub-contractor performance
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Wuhu Feishang sub-contracts its ore extraction work to a third party. To some extent, the Company&#146;s operations are affected by the performance of the contractor, whose activities are not within the Company&#146;s control. If the contractor fails to achieve the guaranteed monthly extraction volume, or the contractor otherwise fails to perform its obligations under its agreement with the Company, the agreement may be terminated by the Company; however, termination of the relationship could adversely affect the Company&#146;s operating results and cash flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(f)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Commodity risk
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The cash flows and profitability of Wuhu Feishang&#146;s current operations are significantly affected by the market price of zinc and iron. These commodity prices can fluctuate widely and are affected by factors beyond Wuhu Feishang&#146;s control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-38
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX; PADDING-TOP:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:11.133PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	(Amounts in thousands, except share and per share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	CONCENTRATION OF RISK (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(g)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Foreign currency risk
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The RMB is not freely convertible into foreign currencies. The State Administration for Foreign Exchange, under the authority of People&#146;s Bank of China, controls the conversion of the RMB into foreign currencies. The value of the RMB is subject to changes in PRC government policies and to international economic and political developments affecting supply and demand in the China Foreign Exchange Trading System market. All foreign exchange transactions continue to take place either through the People&#146;s Bank of China or other banks authorized to buy and sell foreign currencies at the exchange rates quoted by the People&#146;s Bank of China.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	15.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Land rehabilitation accrual
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	According to the &#147;Rules on Mineral Resources Administration&#148; and &#147;Rules on Land Rehabilitation&#148; of the PRC, mining companies causing damages to cultivated land, grassland or forest are required to restore the land to a state approved by the local governments. Wuhu Feishang has been accruing RMB0.018/ MT (metric ton) of ore extracted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008, and 2009, rehabilitation expenses of RMB1,735 (US$254), RMB1,775 (US$260) and RMB2,105 (US$308), respectively, were charged to operations and included in cost of sales. At December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009, the Company has accrued RMB10,087 (US$1,477) and RMB12,192 (US$1,786), respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; TEXT-INDENT:32PX; WIDTH:64PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<I>
	Environmental charges
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	The Company&#146;s mining and exploration activities are subject to various PRC laws and regulations governing the protection of the environment. These law and regulations are continually changing and are generally becoming more restrictive. The Company conducts its operations so as to protect the public health and environment and believes its operations are in compliance with applicable laws and regulations in all material respects.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	Wuhu Feishang&#146;s mining operations are subject to &#147;Natural Resources Compensation Charges&#148; at 2% of Wuhu Feishang sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; PADDING-LEFT:64PX">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008, and 2009, Natural Resource Compensation Charges of RMB2,420 (US$354), RMB1,420 (US$208), and RMB614 (US$90), respectively, were charged to operations and included in cost of sales. At December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009, the Company has accrued RMB9,580 (US$1,403) and RMB9,580 (US$1,403), respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	16.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	SEGMENT INFORMATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	Operating segments are defined as components of an enterprise for which separate financial information is available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision makers in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX">
	Beginning in January&nbsp;2009, with the acquisition of Newhold and Pineboom, the Company has three reportable segments. The accounting policies of the three segments are the same, and are as described in the summary of significant accounting policies. The Company evaluates performance based on operating earnings of the respective business units.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-39
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_56"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	SEGMENT INFORMATION (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	As of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, segment results were as follows:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; FONT-SIZE:10PT" CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 ALIGN=CENTER>
<TR HEIGHT=0 STYLE="FONT-SIZE:0">
<TD WIDTH=184.133 />
<TD WIDTH=16.667 />
<TD WIDTH=3.333 />
<TD WIDTH=66.933 />
<TD WIDTH=16.667 />
<TD WIDTH=3.4 />
<TD WIDTH=67 />
<TD WIDTH=16.733 />
<TD WIDTH=3.4 />
<TD WIDTH=67 />
<TD WIDTH=16.733 />
<TD WIDTH=3.4 />
<TD WIDTH=67 />

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Beginning in March&nbsp;2008, with the acquisition of Mark Faith and through December&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company had two reportable segments, for which the accounting policies of the segments were the same as those described in the summary of significant accounting policies. The Company evaluated performance based on operating earnings of the respective business units.

<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:8.867PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:32PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
<B>
	17.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:32PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX">
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:30.067PX; CLEAR:LEFT">
	On April&nbsp;30, 2010, the Company acquired all the issued and outstanding capital stock of Wealthy Year Limited (&#147;Wealthy Year&#148;), a BVI company, and its wholly-owned subsidiaries from the Shareholder and assumed the outstanding indebtedness owed by Wealthy Year to the Shareholder on the closing date. The total purchase price for the shares and indebtedness was RMB593,949 (US$87,000) (the &#147;Consideration&#148;), subject to adjustments.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:30.067PX">
	Wealthy Year was incorporated under the laws of the BVI in January&nbsp;2010. Wealthy Year owns 100% of the issued and outstanding share capital of Hong Kong Smartact Limited (&#147;Smartact&#148;), which was incorporated under the laws of Hong Kong in January&nbsp;2010. Smartact in turn owns 100% of the share capital of Guizhou Fuyuantong Energy Co., Ltd. (&#147;Guizhou Fuyuantong&#148;), a company organized under the laws of the PRC. Guizhou Fuyuantong owns all of the issued and outstanding capital shares of Guizhou Puxin Energy Co., Ltd. (&#147;Guizhou Puxin&#148;), a company organized under the laws of the PRC. Wealthy Year, Smartact, Guizhou Fuyuantong and Guizhou Puxin are holding companies that do not conduct active operations. Guizhou Puxin beneficially owns 99% of the registered capital of Nayong Dayuan Coal Mining Co. Ltd. Nayong Gouchang Coal Mining Co. Ltd., Liuzhi Linjiaao Coal Mining Co. Ltd., and Liuzhi Xinsong Coal Mining Co. Ltd., and 70% of the registered capital of Jinsha Baiping Mining Co., Ltd.. Each of the above five majority-owned subsidiaries owns the mining rights to and operates a coal mine located in Guizhou Province, in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:11PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
	F-41
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>

	STATEMENTS OF OPERATIONS

	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009

	(Amounts in thousands, except share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX" ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
	NOTE TO SCHEDULE 1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:13.333PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	Schedule 1 has been provided pursuant to the requirements of Rule&nbsp;12-04(a) and 4-08(e)(3) of Regulation&nbsp;S-X, which require condensed financial information as to financial position, changes in financial position and results and operations of a parent company as of the same dates and for the same periods for which audited consolidated financial statements have been presented when the restricted net assets of the consolidated and unconsolidated subsidiaries together exceed 25&nbsp;percent of consolidated net assets as of end of the most recently completed fiscal year. As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, RMB239,008 of the restricted capital and reserves are not available for distribution, and as such, the condensed financial information of the Company has been presented for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008 and 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2008 and 2009, no cash dividends were declared and/or paid by subsidiaries of the Company.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<A NAME="CHNR_EX12Z1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX" ALIGN=RIGHT>
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;12.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<U>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO RULE 13a-15(e) OR 15d-15(e) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX">
	I, Li Feilie, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;20-F of China Natural Resources, Inc. (the &#147;Registrant&#148;);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the year covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the Registrant as of, and for, the years presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15-d-15(f)) for the Registrant and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the Registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the year in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the Registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the year covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	d) Disclosed in this report any change in the Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the Registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the Registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the Registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the Registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the Registrant's internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:28.4PX; TEXT-INDENT:-28.4PX">
	Date: May 26, 2010
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	/s/ Li Feilie
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:28.4PX; TEXT-INDENT:-28.4PX">
	Chief Executive Officer
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_12>

	1.

	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the year covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the Registrant as of, and for, the years presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT; FLOAT:LEFT">
	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15-d-15(f)) for the Registrant and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the Registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the year in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12PT; MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the Registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusion about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the year covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	d) Disclosed in this report any change in the Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the Registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and;
</P>
<P STYLE=MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-1PT;FONT-SIZE:1PT />
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-2PX; WIDTH:24PX; FLOAT:LEFT">
	5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; TEXT-INDENT:-2PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the Registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the Registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:5.533PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:5.533PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX; CLEAR:LEFT" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the Registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:24PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the Registrant's internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:8.867PX; PADDING-LEFT:28.267PX; TEXT-INDENT:-28.267PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
